body_html:
Note, this only seems to break when we're not at global scope. The following works:

import torch

@torch.jit.trace(torch.rand(3, 3))
def traced_fn(x):
    return torch.neg(x)

class ScriptMod(torch.jit.ScriptModule):
    def __init__(self):
        super(ScriptMod, self).__init__()
        self.param = torch.nn.Parameter(torch.rand(4, 3))

    @torch.jit.script_method
    def forward(self, x):
        return traced_fn(torch.mm(x, self.param))

sm = ScriptMod()

The following doesn't:

import torch

def test_fn():
    @torch.jit.trace(torch.rand(3, 3))
    def traced_fn(x):
        return torch.neg(x)

    class ScriptMod(torch.jit.ScriptModule):
        def __init__(self):
            super(ScriptMod, self).__init__()
            self.param = torch.nn.Parameter(torch.rand(4, 3))

        @torch.jit.script_method
        def forward(self, x):
            return traced_fn(torch.mm(x, self.param))

    sm = ScriptMod()

test_fn()

14:39:04 ~ $ python resolve.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "resolve.py", line 19, in <module>
    test_fn()
  File "resolve.py", line 17, in test_fn
    sm = ScriptMod()
  File "/Users/jamesreed/onnx-fairseq/pytorch/torch/jit/__init__.py", line 558, in init_then_register
    self._create_methods(asts, rcbs)
RuntimeError:
undefined value traced_fn:
@torch.jit.script_method
def forward(self, x):
    return traced_fn(torch.mm(x, self.param))
